parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Arguments in MP</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Effects in MP</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Animations </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> When used on a person, smooth transition to given move will be done.<br>
The difference between [[playMove]] and [[playMoveNow]] is that [[playMove]] adds another move to the move queue, while [[playMoveNow]] replaces the whole move queue with new move (see [[#Examples|Example 2]]).
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> see [[:Category:Moves]] for respective games animations.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName [[playMove]] moveName </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value>  moveName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>soldierOne [[playMove]] "Stand";</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[switchMove]] "AmovPercMstpSrasWrflDnon"; 
[] [[spawn]] 
{
	[[sleep]] 0.5; 
	[[player]] [[playMove]] "AmovPpneMstpSrasWrflDnon"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>player goes prone</value></part></template>
	[[player]] [[playMove]] "amovPknlMstpSrasWrflDnon"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>player gets up on one knee</value></part></template>
};</code>
<code>[[player]] [[switchMove]] "amovpercmstpsraswrfldnon";
[] [[spawn]]
{
	[[sleep]] 0.5; 
	[[player]] [[playMove]] "AmovPpneMstpSrasWrflDnon"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>player never goes prone</value></part></template>
	[[player]] [[playMoveNow]] "AmovPknlMstpSrasWrflDnon"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>player goes down on one knee straight away</value></part></template>
};</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[playMoveNow]], [[switchMove]], [[playAction]], [[playActionNow]] </value></part><part><name>See also</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">Unknown
<dd class="note">For an immediate transition use [[switchMove]]. This command must be executed after mission start. If you place it into init.sqs / init.sqf or in the Init field of some unit, it will not work. Just add a little delay (~0.001) and then place the command.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
